result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] was dismissed by the court.

  • David G Wolk was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 56 days time served. Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program for first two years of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision. Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician. No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No intoxicants. Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Do not enter establishment where primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
